title: Have you had a champion that just fits you?
body:
I have been looking for a main for a while but nothing seems to click. Strong or weak, win or lose I just find everyone to be so.... meh... when I play them. Yesterday I bought Ahri because I wanted a new champion but had no preference and alphabetically she was first. I don't play mid lane often but after my first match I realized  love playing Ahri. I don't know what it is about her but her kit,  playstyle and theme is so much fun. I don't care if I win or lose, I just really enjoy her.

I have been playing since preseason one and I have never had a champion click with me before and I own almost all of them. It is pretty sweet.

I really like playing {{champion:89}}. You can be really lazy, mechanically, which gives you a lot more room to wage psychological peacefare (i.e. mediating when two teammates argue), focus on strategy and tactics, warding, and so on, WHILE still having a big impact if you know when and where to make your move and land your skillshots. Plus, you can spam your abilities pretty freely, and I'm a spammy kind of guy. Plus, if you don't like dying, Leona's pretty tanky, so you're more likely to make it out alive. Only disadvantages I can think of are that you can't deal damage by yourself (but why would you need to when your passive basically nukes the enemy when used properly anyways?) and you don't give side utility to your ADC, like haste/slow/heals. But I don't care about those when I can get right in the enemy's face, smack 'em with a sword and leave 'em unable to do anything, and have my ADC deal tons of damage.

My first one was thresh, played him once on free week, started saving IP for him, he is my best by far bot lane. More recently it's been Zac. Bought him on a whim after transitioning to the jungle, I love that big blob. Now if only riot would make a decent skin for him...

{{champion:32}} : Though I found him depressing at first, since he hurts enemies by _raining tears_, all it took was playing him for a little while for me to change my mind. Probably the coolest, most unique character in the game. Plus, he has the best skin in the game, Surprise Party Amumu.
{{champion:104}} : An ADC tanky enough to weather my mistakes, and bursty enough that even I can snowball if I play him correctly? Finally, an ADC that speaks to me.
{{champion:111}} : A tanky support whose kit is nothing but CC? Good luck getting away from me and my ADC.
{{champion:127}} : The Queen of CC top/mid lane. Has a built in Zhonyas with her ult. Easy ranged poke with Q. Mana-free abilities every so often. Easy disengage with W when opponents go in. Gap closer and escape tool with E. Gank me? Think again.
{{champion:19}} (Pre-Nerf) and {{champion:254}} : Easy clears. Can solo dragon easily. Point-and-click ult that is often a guaranteed kill. And for Vi, just insane damage and  the easiest ganks in the game with Q and ult.
{{champion:62}} : Built in armor and magic resistance that scales with how many enemies are around you? A Q that shreds armor. A W that allows for jukes and unexpected engages? An E that's a multi-target gap closer? And an ult that's an AOE knock-up? There is so much you can do with this guy, and so many ways you can build him. Top/jungle/mid. Tank/fighter/assassin. I love it.
{{champion:86}} : My main. A silence which doubles as a speed boost. An E that, coupled with Sunfire Cape, gives you one of the fastest wave clears top lane. And crazy HP regen which, together with his W, makes him almost impossible to kill when ahead and/or fed.
{{champion:122}} : True damage ult with a temporary reset on a kill, and a full reset with 3 points in it? A hook to reel in fleeing enemies? A ranged poke with Q? His bleed passive, which is often enough to kill people on its own even without ult? Plus another of the best skins in the game, Dunkmaster Darius? Hell yes!

That about covers the ones that "fit" me the most.

I have many that fit and use often but ill use Volibear. They usually follow this sort of criteria. 

1. I want my champions to be intimidating, none that yordle crap.

- He is a fucking lightning bear. 

2. Tank. I tend to be best at soaking damage and causing havok in fights, think {{champion:48}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:9}} type champions. 

- Volibear builds health and his passive is just amazing, I find people igniting me well before it goes off, I find myself tanking an entire team while doing large amounts of damage, so yeah. Need someone who can take some hits. And give him {{item:3065}} and {{item:3083}} oh god it is beautiful.

3. CC Kind of relates to the above, but if my champion can't really do CC I just don't play them.

Voli has the Q flip and the E aoe slow
 


Don't know if I explained right but I like my champions to fit my playstyle with the game, I want  to be able to dive teams but I want to make sure I am a force to be reckoned with. They WILL die if they ignore me, but at the same time my passive keeps me around long enough to at least execute the carry, or allow my team to kill them too. Or shit sometimes I just 1v3 them without a hitch, and Voli just does it so well.

For me it's Lulu and Janna. They have some of everything; shields, speed, hard CC, slows, heals... What more could a support possibly wish for? My entire goal in a game is to save as many people as possible, and they're just perfect for that.

But mainly it's the fact that both have hilarious quirky personalities (Forecast Janna, only Janna skin I'll ever use) that make playing them a blast, win or lose.

I think {{champion:63}} is freaking awesome. Just started using him and boy is he fun. I like playing passive and careful. I feel with him you can safely farm and level near turret but he also had the ability to wreck your shit with AP if you get close to him. He deals lots of damage and his great in teamfights. Ive played and practiced with fiddle, lux, hiemerdinger, and renekton. I think brands the one i enjoy playing the most.

I think the first champ that click to me was Wukong. It was after I've played all in bot lane before level 30. 

I love his mechanics and it click with my playstyle. I can go all tanky or all fighter and still be good. I have tried Wukong support in URF and I love to use his w. Hilarious.

I should play more top lane too tough. For this reason, I can't practice with him a lot. In ARAM, for example, I am a beast as Wukong. It's so fun ! ^^

I love Janna, Shen and recently Quinn too. But really, I think Wukong will stay on the top for me.

She was  very easy for me and provided fast pace gameplay. I could go full ap burst or bruiser diana and both did well. {{champion:77}}  I've always liked druid/shaman style characters. In any role-playing game they're my go to classes. If he actually shape shifted into his stance animals, I would never play another champion ever again.

Basically, you gotta find a champ that matches your preferred play style. Here are some examples of champs I like and how they match my preferred play style.

{{champion:75}} When it comes to top lane, I like playing on the defensive while having farming as my highest priority. That's why I like Nasus as he can farm under turret with his Q easily, build tank and still do damage from any of the sheen passives, and stave off death in lane (especially tower dives) with his W, R, and passive lifesteal.

{{champion:90}} When I picked up mid lane, getting good at farming was priority #1. With Malzahar's E, I was able to farm safely even if I was losing lane, and I loved the utility/damage that his W+R combo dealt especially if you have a teammate nearby. Let alone that he is a great counter to Yasuo who was popular at the time I picked up Malz.

{{champion:40}} Support was the first role I picked up and is the one i main today. I can't really explain why Janna is my preferred support sadly enough. She has been known as the queen of peel, and I've picked up a few tricks like shielding allies as a projectile is already flying at them and landing a quick gale on 3 people at once.

Ever since {{champion:112}} was released he's been like my spirit animal...cyborg. Up until recently when some pro played him I had never seen anyone else play him but me, so it felt like he was made for me specifically. My own hidden OP champion I could always rely on and never fear him being banned, and since no one knew what he did he was even stronger. When I get fed I can 1v2 or even 1v3 and win. My proudest moment was when I was ambushed 4v1 and I lived with a quadrakill. It was 20 minutes into the game so they instantly surrendered and called Viktor OP.
